meanings.definition: To scold someone more severely or loudly than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always outscolds her little brother when he misbehaves.
meanings.sent2: The teacher outscolds the students who talk during class.
meanings.sent3: The strict librarian outscolds even the noisiest patrons.
meanings.sent4: Her voice outscolds the roaring thunderstorm outside.
meanings.sent5: The angry principal outscolds everyone in the school with her booming voice.

meanings.definition: A person who scolds others more severely or loudly than others.
meanings.sent1: He is known as the outscolds of the neighborhood for his constant reprimands.
meanings.sent2: The outscolds in the office always make sure everyone follows the rules.
meanings.sent3: The outscolds at the park keep the children in line with their stern warnings.
meanings.sent4: She became the outscolds of the family after scolding her siblings for their mess.
meanings.sent5: The outscolds of the group never hesitates to speak up when someone is misbehaving.
